items.title: In Gun State Of Wyoming, Suicide Prevention Aims For Firearm Safety

items.snippet:

rates of gun ownership in the country. But it also has the highest per capita 
suicide rate, and guns are usually involved. One grieving mother is trying to boost 
awareness while respecting the state's gun culture.

metatags.og:title: End of an Era: Winchester Rifle Production to Stop
metatags.og:description: After more than a century, the classic Winchester rifle -- the "Gun that Won the West" -- is set to ride off into the sunset. This month, the European company that owns the Winchester plant in New Haven, Conn., said the gun will no longer be made in the United States. The iconic weapon just isn't as popular as it used to be. John Dankosky of member station WNPR reports.

items.title: Semi-Automatic Rifle Arrives In TV Box : NPR

items.snippet:

com, UPS and the seller. Nobody took responsibility. But police were happy to 
take the gun, which is illegal in the nation's capital.

items.snippet:
May 7, 2016 ... Babies are much less likely to get the flu in their first months of life if mom got a flu 
shot while she was pregnant, a study finds. Yet most expectant mothers don't get 
immunized.

metatags.og:description: Babies are much less likely to get the flu in their first months of life if mom got a flu shot while she was pregnant, a study finds. Yet most expectant mothers don't get immunized.

items.title: Flu Season This Year Could Be Unusually Harsh : Shots - Health ...
items.htmlTitle: Flu Season This Year Could Be Unusually Harsh : Shots - Health ...
items.snippet:
Dec 8, 2017 ... Health officials fear the U.S. may have a nasty flu season because the main flu 
virus circulating this year tends to hit people hard and the flu vaccine may be 
weaker than normal.

items.title: White Supremacist Murderer Who Shot Larry Flynt Is Executed : The ...
items.htmlTitle: White Supremacist Murderer Who Shot Larry Flynt Is Executed : The ...
items.snippet:
Nov 20, 2013 ... Joseph Paul Franklin, who was convicted of eight murders, suspected in as many 
as 20 others and who shot Hustler publisher Larry Flynt in 1978, was put to death 
Wednesday in Missouri. He also shot and seriously wounded civil rights leader 
Vernon Jordan in 1980.

items.title: Cold Casing: The Mystery Of The Long-Lost Winchester Rifle : NPR
items.htmlTitle: Cold Casing: The Mystery Of The Long-Lost Winchester Rifle : NPR
items.snippet:
Jan 19, 2015 ... For archaeologist Eva Jensen, a happenstance find in Nevada has turned into an 
in-depth quest. Since stumbling across a Winchester rifle manufactured in 1882, 
she and other researchers have been seeking to unravel the mysteries behind it. 
ROBERT SIEGEL, HOST: Here's a lost and found story.

items.title: An Indonesian Extremist Trades Rifle For Spatula : NPR
items.htmlTitle: An Indonesian Extremist Trades Rifle For Spatula : NPR
items.snippet:
Feb 21, 2013 ... Between 2002 and 2009, homegrown Indonesian militants staged deadly attacks 
almost yearly. The story of one former terrorist-turned-chef — and his unrealized 
dreams of global jihad — help illustrate why terrorism hasn't flourished in the 
Muslim-majority country.

items.title: US Teenager Ginny Thrasher Wins The First Gold In Rio, In Air Rifle

items.snippet:

, winning the first of more than 300 medals that will be awarded at the Summer 
Olympics.

right to buy these guns, home protection is low on the list of ...

metatags.og:title: Why The AR-15 Is More Than Just A Gun
metatags.og:description: For some, it's a symbol of America's might. For others, it's a frightening weapon of warfare. For many target-shooting hobbyists, it's "the Mr. Potato Head of firearms" — customizable to fit each individual. And it's all part of what is now a nearly billion-dollar business in military-style weapons.

metatags.og:title: Do U.S. Troops Risk Brain Injury When They Fire Heavy Weapons?
metatags.og:description: Some modern shoulder-fired weapons produce blast waves powerful enough to rattle the brain. A $30 million study aims to help the military figure out how much blast exposure, over time, is too much.

metatags.og:title: American Sees Silver Slip Away In Rifle Event's Final Shot
metatags.og:description: U.S. rifle shooter Matthew Emmons has won a bronze medal in the 50-meter three positions rifle event. That may sound like a slight let-down for the man who had been poised to win silver — a horrible final shot of 7.6 dropped him into third place — but it's far better than Emmons' earlier Olympic experiences.

items.title: End of an Era: Winchester Rifle Production to Stop : NPR
items.htmlTitle: End of an Era: Winchester Rifle Production to Stop : NPR
items.snippet:
Jan 23, 2006 ... After more than a century, the classic Winchester rifle -- the "Gun that Won the 
West" -- is set to ride off into the sunset. This month, the European company that 
owns the Winchester plant in New Haven, Conn., said the gun will no longer be 
made in the United States. The iconic weapon just isn't as popular ...

metatags.viewport: width=device-width, initial-scale=1, minimum-scale=1, maximum-scale=1, user-scalable=no, shrink-to-fit=no
metatags.og:title: End of an Era: Winchester Rifle Production to Stop
metatags.og:description: After more than a century, the classic Winchester rifle -- the "Gun that Won the West" -- is set to ride off into the sunset. This month, the European company that owns the Winchester plant in New Haven, Conn., said the gun will no longer be made in the United States. The iconic weapon just isn't as popular as it used to be. John Dankosky of member station WNPR reports.

items.title: Semi-Automatic Rifle Arrives In TV Box : NPR
items.htmlTitle: Semi-Automatic Rifle Arrives In TV Box : NPR
items.snippet:
Aug 10, 2012 ... Seth Horvitz of Washington D. C. says all he wanted was a television. Instead he 
received a military-grade semi-automatic rifle. Horvitz complained to Amazon.
com, UPS and the seller. Nobody took responsibility. But police were happy to 
take the gun, which is illegal in the nation's capital.
